intro: Cladomyza laevis, commonly known as the smooth cladomyza, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
